product_name: Beekman 1802Milk Tint SPF 43 Tinted Primer Serum
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackBeekman 1802's Milk Tint Tinted Primer Serum protects with SPF 43 and gives skin a pore-blurring tint that flexes to adapt to every skin tone in a range of shades.
details: DetailsBenefitsReduces the appearance of pores and evens skin toneProvides daily defense with SPF 43 broad-spectrum sun protectionPerfects skin for makeup application or that flawless no-makeup lookSoft, weightless finishDeeply hydratesKey IngredientsGoat Milk: nourishes and softens the skin around the eyeMineral Zinc Oxide: an effective natural sun protectant that shields the skin from harmful UVA and UVB rays, as well as blue lightElderberry: helps decrease the effect of UVB rays on skin cells that cause inflammation and photoagingNiacinamide: boosts hydration, improves skin texture, and fades the appearance of dark spotsFormulated without fragrance, parabens, sulfates, mineral oil, alcohol, and talcResearch Results93% agreed skin looks more even-toned.*100% said product feels weightless on the skin.*91% agreed skin looks healthy.**Based on a 1-week clinical study while used as directed.Item 2624068How To UseSHAKE WELL. Squeeze a quarter sized amount into palms and massage into skin on the face, blending well to ensure full coverage.IngredientsActive: Zinc Oxide 13%. Inactive: Water (Aqua), Squalane, Isoamyl Laurate, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Propanediol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Polyglyceryl-3 Diisostearate, Methylpropanediol, Isopropyl Isostearate, Niacinamide, Sodium Chloride, Polyglyceryl-6 Polyricinoleate, Silica, Sorbitan Sesquiisostearate, Caprae Lac (Goat Milk), Bifida Ferment Lysate, Milk Protein, Eryngium Alpinum (Blue Thistle) Flower Extract, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, Sambucus Nigra (Elderberry) Flower Extract, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Isostearic Acid, Lecithin, Polyglyceryl-3 Polyricinoleate, Polyhydroxystearic Acid, Hydroxyacetophenone, Mica, 1,2-Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Lauroyl Lysine, Glycerin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Lactose... and Kindness.May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77499).Does not contain live cultures.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: SHAKE WELL. Squeeze a quarter sized amount into palms and massage into skin on the face, blending well to ensure full coverage.
ingredients: Lactose... and Kindness.May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (

reviews.headline: Its good but not fitted for some circumstances
reviews.comments: This is a really good tinted primer (more like moisturizer). very hydrating and super pigmented, not chalky and dry like most tinted anything that's not a foundation. This is best suited for dry skin or people who live it dry climates. if you have oily skin or live in humid weather regions. This is a no go, unless you are going for that makeup no makeup look but even then you will have yo really set it because your face will turn into a grease pan, especially if you are wearing makeup. Your face will melt. Its light like a super moisturizer but acts like a foundation, its weird. Highly recommend applying with a sponge or using a sponge to remove excess before taking off. Again I like it but can't wear it on the day to day.

reviews.headline: Blends well and looks natural
reviews.comments: I purchased this product because I wanted a light coverage with SPF protection and it's exactly that! I've tried tinted moisturizer from another brand and it's just ok but this Beekman Milk Tint is exactly what I have been looking for. It rubs in smooth and gives just the right amount of coverage, giving me a polished natural look. I don't wear any makeup over it. I do think it looks better when my skin is exfoliated and well moisturized so I'm not sure how I will like during midwest winters but at least it's a great summer option.

reviews.headline: Horrible smell and finish
reviews.comments: I love beekman 1802 products but this one i had to return. The stench is so horrible i couldnt stand having it on my face. After an hour of wear it dries out, turns into a powdered mess, and looks crackled and wrinckled even if youre not. Strong yes on other beekman products, but a hard noooooo to this one

reviews.headline: This stuff is amazing!
reviews.comments: I have mature skin and this tint does not have a bad smell, its not heavy, it doesnt seep into facial lines, and it looks natural. It also stays all day and your face feels hydrated but not oily. Its amazing!!!

reviews.headline: This stuff is amazing!
reviews.comments: I have mature skin and this tint does not have a bad smell, its not heavy, it doesnt seep into facial lines, and it looks natural. It also stays all day and your face feels hydrated but not oily. Its amazing!!!

reviews.headline: Amazing For 30+ Skin!
reviews.comments: This serum is so awesome! I am over 35 and it just melts into my skin! You cant tell that I'm wearing anything and I often get compliments on how great my skin looks. The comments are most often, "your skin is glowing," or shock that I'm not younger than my age when people find out my age. I just use it as a foundation and it has good coverage! I love that it nourishes and protects my skin at the same time!

reviews.headline: Best foundation ever
reviews.comments: Easy to apply. Looks very natural. I dont feel like I'm wearing a foundation. Im very grateful to the consultant at Ulta that recommended this product and with their generous return policy, i had nothing to loose. I highly recommend!

reviews.headline: Best tinted serum!
reviews.comments:
I have used many cc and bb creams in the past and I just couldn't find something that I like. I have oily skin so it was always way too greasy for me. 

This tinted serum is awesome. It is kinda greasy at first but it is quickly absorbed by the skin leaving your face with a dewy/glass skin finish. 

I have had so many people telling me that I have great skin since I have been using this serum. 

I love it! I definitely recommend it!

reviews.headline: Absolutely not a primer.
reviews.comments: I typically very much love beekman, but this product was not it. I have no idea how it could even be considered as a primer, but even on its own it's a very poor product. I've been using it as a tinted moisturizer and because I have rosacea the zinc from the spf helps with my redness, but as soon as it goes on my clean dry face it separates and i've never even had lower quality brands do that. I'm a makeup artist and have used plenty of primers/tinted moisturizers/foundations and this takes the cake for the worst one. I'm just not really sure what they were going for here. Trying to blend any cream/liquid products on top such as concealer or blush creates a patchy, separated mess as well. And putting powder on top somehow makes it even worse. Save your money and try something else!

reviews.headline: My go to every day!
reviews.comments: I love the the look and feel of this product! As long as they make it exactly the way it is and don't sell out, I will buy and use it everyday!

reviews.headline: Surprised!
reviews.comments: I tried many tinted serums and having oily skin it always left my skin even more oily or I could feel it in my skin like foundation. This is different!! It is very light and dries super quickly. It still looked great on the T zone after one day.  I put a small amount on my skin and it evens everything out. I definitely recommend.

reviews.headline: Too shiny for a primer
reviews.comments: I wanted to love their milk primer but every bottle I bought dispensed poorly with clumps forming. This is a better product. It applied fine over a serum and a moisturizer, I used a dense brush. My only complaint is its very shiny. It matted down a bit when I put stick makeup over it but the application was pretty slidy.

reviews.headline: Meh
reviews.comments: I wanted to really love this brand but I don't. Purchased in the medium to use light a tinted moisturizer. Its too light, seperates and doesn't provide much coverage. I'm trying yo use it soi don't waste it. Currently using as a primer under my other products and it's definitely working better as a primer. I won't purchase again.

reviews.headline: A good daily, light makeup option
reviews.comments:
The good- This product is light weight, goes on like a dream and sits on my skin nicely for several hours and gives a nice light glow to my skin. 

The bad- it has s very earthy/goat scent the first few seconds while I'm applying, but dissipates as it dries down. 
While it does contain SPF, youd have to use 1/2 the bottle for it to be effective. 

I like the product and will use the rest of my bottle, but I don't know if it will be a repurchase for me.

reviews.headline: I wanted to like this
reviews.comments: I wanted to like this so badly. Beekman 1802 has not disappointed me until this product. Its so thick, it feels and smells like watered down sunscreen. I bought the fair shade and it was so white. Ive got fair skin but this was way lighter than my skin tone. It gets patchy quickly. And you have to shake the crap out of this bottle to get everything to mix well, at least thats been my experience. If not, it just flakes right off when i apply it.

reviews.headline: Really nice tinted serum!
reviews.comments: This is currently my favorite tinted serum and I have tried many in all price points. It blends well for me, is lightly hydrating for my dry skin, isn't sticky, and plays nicely with the rest if my skincare and makeup. I find myself reaching for this tinted serum more frequently than all my others right now.

reviews.headline: Just Okay
reviews.comments: I love the concept of this but it doesnt work great with my dry skin. I really have to be diligent with my skin care on the days I use this, otherwise I look very patchy!

reviews.headline: Absolutely love this!!
reviews.comments: This is my holy grail "foundation" it blends like a dream and leaves you looking so glowy. I never look cakey either! 10/10

reviews.headline: Would not buy again
reviews.comments: I love clean face products.. this one didn't work for me. Made me break out and even when I shook it alot of back dark dye was mixed in with it. Would not buy again. Love all the other Beekman products, but not a fan of this one

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments:
I really wanted to love it.
Unfortunately it doesn't go well with my cream. It became patchy in just an hour.
Fair is still too light.

media.headline: I like how beautiful it looks on my skin!

faceoff_positive.comments:
The Beekman 1802 Milk Shake
Hyaluronic Acid & Squalane Facial Toner Mist is one of my holy grail skincare products. I have mature dry skin so I always look for skincare that will plump, hydrate and feed my skin. I wear sunscreen every day no matter the weather or circumstance. This broad spectrum Milk Tint
SPF 43 Tinted Primer Serum is wonderful. I was going to return it but decided to give it one more try after a disastrous first use. First go round I took the entire 1/4 teaspoon advised for full sunscreen efficacy and applied all of it to my face. That was an absolute mistake on my part. The Milk Tint welled up in every fine line, would not dry down and felt oddly heavy on my skin. The second time I used it I took the same 1/4 teaspoon and applied in a thin layer which my skin absorbed readily. I let that dry down for 15 minutes. I then applied a second layer which finished up the rest of the 1/4 teaspoon amount and again the product absorbed and dried down to a glowy, dewy and lit from within finish. I threw on a bit of concealer here and there and was good to go. In conclusion, I adore the Milk Tint, will repurchase and am really happy I took a minute to learn how this product needs to be applied.
faceoff_positive.headline: New Holy Grail sun protection

faceoff_negative.comments: I typically very much love beekman, but this product was not it. I have no idea how it could even be considered as a primer, but even on its own it's a very poor product. I've been using it as a tinted moisturizer and because I have rosacea the zinc from the spf helps with my redness, but as soon as it goes on my clean dry face it separates and i've never even had lower quality brands do that. I'm a makeup artist and have used plenty of primers/tinted moisturizers/foundations and this takes the cake for the worst one. I'm just not really sure what they were going for here. Trying to blend any cream/liquid products on top such as concealer or blush creates a patchy, separated mess as well. And putting powder on top somehow makes it even worse. Save your money and try something else!
faceoff_negative.headline: Absolutely not a primer.

rollup.name: Milk Tint SPF 43 Tinted Primer Serum
